1.brief: properly, to sit down (specifically as judge. in ambush, in quiet); by implication, to dwell, to remain; causatively, to settle, to marry
a cover (in a good or a bad, a literal or a figurative sense)
an elevation, i.e. (adj.) lofty (compar.); as title, the Supreme
to stop (usually over night); by implication, to stay permanently; hence (in a bad sense) to be obstinate (especially in words, to complain)

2.brief: Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
a net, or (abstractly) capture; also a fastness

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
figuratively, to trust, be confident or sure

3.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed

he (she or it); only expressed when emphatic or without a verb; also (intensively) self, or (especially with the article) the same; sometimes (as demonstrative) this or that; occasionally (instead of copula) as or are
to snatch away, whether in a good or a bad sense
a (metallic) sheet (as pounded thin); also a spring net (as spread out like a lamina)
properly, entangled, i.e. by implication (intransitively) a snare, or (transitive) a snarer
by implication, of falling); desire; also ruin

4.brief: properly, to entwine as ascreen; by implication, to fence in, cover over, (figuratively) protect
the bottom (as depressed); only adverbially, below (often with prepositional prefix underneath), in lieu of, etc.
an edge or extremity; specifically (of a bird or army) a wing, (of a garment or bedclothing) a flap, (of the earth) a quarter, (of a building) a pinnacle
to flee for protection; figuratively, to confide in
a hook (as pointed); also a (large) shield (as if guarding by prickliness); also cold (as piercing)
something surrounding the person, i.e. a shield

5.brief: not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to fear; morally, to revere; caus. to frighten
a (sudden) alarm (properly, the object feared, by implication, the feeling)
properly, a twist (away of the light), i.e. night; figuratively, adversity
properly, a piercer, i.e. an arrow; by implication, a wound; figuratively, (of God) thunderbolt; the shaft of aspear
to fly; also (by implication of dimness) to faint (from the darkness of swooning)

6.brief: to walk (in a great variety of applications, literally and figuratively)
properly, to swell up, i.e. figuratively (by implication of insolence) to devastate
a light (i.e. window); dual double light, i.e. noon

7.brief: to fall, in a great variety of applications (intransitive or causative, literal or figurative)
hence (the ox's head being the first letter of the alphabet, and this eventually used as a numeral) a thousand
abundance (in number), i.e. (specifically) a myriad (whether definite or indefinite)
the right hand or side (leg, eye) of a person or other object (as the stronger and more dexterous); locally, the south
near, with or among; often in general, to
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles

to be or come (causatively, bring) near (for any purpose); euphemistically, to lie with a woman; as an enemy, to attack; religious to worship; causatively, to present; figuratively, to adduce an argument; by reversal, to stand back

8.brief: properly, leanness, i.e. (figuratively) limitation; only adverbial, merely, or conjunctional, although
an eye (literally or figuratively); by analogy, a fountain (as the eye of the landscape)
to scan, i.e. look intently at; by implication, to regard with pleasure, favor or care
morally wrong; concretely, an (actively) bad person
to see, literally or figuratively (in numerous applications, direct and implied, transitive, intransitive and causative)

9.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
thou and thee, or (plural) ye and you
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
an elevation, i.e. (adj.) lofty (compar.); as title, the Supreme
to put (used in a great variety of applications, literal, figurative, inferentially, and elliptically)
an abode, of God (the Tabernacle or the Temple), men (their home) or animals (their lair); hence, a retreat (asylum)

10.brief: not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to approach; hence, to meet in various senses
near, with or among; often in general, to
bad or (as noun) evil (natural or moral)
a blow (figuratively, infliction); also (by implication) a spot (concretely, a leprous person or dress)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to approach (causatively, bring near) for whatever purpose
a tent (as clearly conspicuous from a distance)

11.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
a messenger; specifically, of God, i.e. an angel (also a prophet, priest or teacher)
properly, to hedge about (as with thorns), i.e. guard; generally, to protect, attend to, etc.
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
a road (as trodden); figuratively, a course of life or mode of action, often adverb

12.brief: above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
the hollow hand or palm (so of the paw of an animal, of the sole, and even of the bowl of a dish or sling, the handle of a bolt, the leaves of a palm-tree); figuratively, power
to lift, in a great variety of applications, literal and figurative, absolute and relative
properly, removal; used only (in the construction) adverb as conjunction, lest
to push, gore, defeat, stub (the toe), inflict (a disease)
a foot (as used in walking); by implication, a step; by euphemistically the pudenda

13.brief: above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
to tread; by implication, to walk; also to string abow (by treading on it in bending)
to tread upon (as a potter, in walking or abusively)
a village (as covered in by walls); also a young lion (perhaps as covered with a mane)
a marine or land monster, i.e. sea-serpent or jackal

14.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
to cling, i.e. join, (figuratively) to love, delight in; elliptically; to deliver
to slip out, i.e. escape; causatively, to deliver
to be (causatively, make) lofty, especially inaccessible; by implication, safe, strong; used literally and figuratively
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed

to know (properly, to ascertain by seeing); used in a great variety of senses, figuratively, literally, euphemistically and inferentially (including observation, care, recognition; and causatively, instruction, designation, punishment, etc.)
an appellation, as amark or memorial of individuality; by implication honor, authority, character

15.brief: to call out to (i.e. properly, address by name, but used in a wide variety of applications)
properly, to eye or (generally) to heed, i.e. pay attention; by implication, to respond; by extension to begin to speak; specifically to sing, shout, testify, announce
adverb or preposition, with (i.e. in conjunction with), in varied applications; specifically, equally with; often with prepositional prefix (and then usually unrepresented in English)
tightness (i.e. figuratively, trouble); transitively, a female rival:
to pull off; hence (intensively) to strip, (reflex.) to depart; by implication, to deliver, equip (for fight); present, strengthen
to be heavy, i.e. in a bad sense (burdensome, severe, dull) or in a good sense (numerous, rich, honorable; causatively, to make weighty (in the same two senses)

16.brief: a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)
to sate, i.e. fill to satisfaction (literally or figuratively)
to see, literally or figuratively (in numerous applications, direct and implied, transitive, intransitive and causative)
something saved, i.e. (abstractly) deliverance; hence, aid, victory, prosperity
